channel.title: Bill Wurtz – Questions
channel.description: Unofficial RSS feed for Bill Wurtz questions

item.title: How many owls do you need to see in a short period before you start thinking something is weird?

1.11.26
Q: How many owls do you need to see in a short period before you start thinking something is weird?
A: that really depends where you are and where the owls are. there are perfectly normal places to see lots of owls

item.title: hey! I'm in the process of reinventing the way I write music and I'm curious where you start your writing process. What do you typically start with when writing music?
item.description:
1.11.26
Q: hey! I'm in the process of reinventing the way I write music and I'm curious where you start your writing process. What do you typically start with when writing music?
A: i start with what level of update i want to be working on. For example: if i'm working on update level zero, i'll come up with some brand new things. If i want to be working on things of update level 1, i'll work on only things that i have come up with before but never updated, and update those things. If i'm working on update level 5, then i'll work on only things that have been updated 5 times (well actually 4 times if you dont count the original inception as an update) i should also mention it's quite often that brand new level 0s come at me out of nowhere sometimes when i wasnt even trying to write. those then get added in and become eligible alongside the other level 1s

item.title: the last line of one of the projects you're working on will contain the letter A.
item.description:
1.11.26
Q: the last line of one of the projects you're working on will contain the letter A.
A: but how much exactly constitutes a 'line'

item.title: How is doubt different from uncertainty
item.description:
1.11.26
Q: How is doubt different from uncertainty
A: the word 'doubt' probably is more like youre leaning toward 'no' about something. but the word 'uncertainty' is probably less specific. it probably just means you dont know. Which makes me realize i think people probably use 'uncertain' to almost mean 'doubtful' and if you think about it that probably doesnt seem fair, from a linguistic standpoint. but as always there's surely way weirder atrocities just around the next corner, in the lagnuage

item.title: Would it be reasonable to call the equals sign ("=") the equator?
item.description:
1.12.26
Q: Would it be reasonable to call the equals sign ("=") the equator?
A: it would be great except in english that word already has a strong universal connotation with the 0 degree latitude line on the earth globe. like even if you were not already talking about globes, youre doing math doing math etc then you say 'equator' and immediately everyone now thinks youre talking about globes. the word is already in use for that. Otherwise it could have been a great word for the equals sign in mathematics, for sure 1.12.26 12:54 am whats your favorite song if any song is any good it ought to be that one, at least while it's on

item.title: hi bill, i have a physics issue I came up with that i want your opinion on: imagine a perfect sphere one meter in diameter, made of a nondescript matter with perfect curvature and no substructures (atoms, quarks, molecules, etc). A perfect sphere, as if someone just drag-and-dropped a UV sphere from blender into the real world. What do you think would happen when our real atoms touched this theoretical object? would our atoms be pushed into each-other, undergoing fusion, or something more interesting?
item.description:
1.12.26
Q: hi bill, i have a physics issue I came up with that i want your opinion on: imagine a perfect sphere one meter in diameter, made of a nondescript matter with perfect curvature and no substructures (atoms, quarks, molecules, etc). A perfect sphere, as if someone just drag-and-dropped a UV sphere from blender into the real world. What do you think would happen when our real atoms touched this theoretical object? would our atoms be pushed into each-other, undergoing fusion, or something more interesting?
A: according to the description it seems to be monkeying with things on a subatomic level, which, at the very least, means i have no idea what would happen, or if the thing would even be visible, or what. but something tells me there is also something not well enough defined about the question. but i assure you i do not know, i am not a physicist

item.title: Where can I get that red bass from your videos
item.description:
1.12.26
Q: Where can I get that red bass from your videos
A: i'm still using it, but the good news is it's not special, so you'll be able to accomplish just as much (probably more) with another bass. With the added benefit of, just in case anyone were to notice this, you wouldnt appear to be copying me (which probably no one would notice anyway, because it is a fairly generic looking instrument)

item.title: Does our free will to make choices actually create alternate timelines or are we just too busy living in our crazy world to realize we're too predictable to make any other choice?
item.description:
1.13.26
Q: Does our free will to make choices actually create alternate timelines or are we just too busy living in our crazy world to realize we're too predictable to make any other choice?
A: i am certainly a believer in the 'many worlds' theory, of infinitely branching timelines at any given moment, and free will is essentially us choosing which one to go on right now. while i also believe that we will probably do all the others EVENTUALLY as it comes back around in infinite million lifetimes. also i think this necessitates the belief that each one will also be chosen infinite times

item.title: Bill, I hope this is not too personal but I remember the time when you didn't feel comfortable sharing your own food consumption preferences (something I find very respectable and reasonable). Can I ask what made you change your mind on the matter? Thanks. Keep up the great work, you are needed.
item.description:
1.14.26
Q: Bill, I hope this is not too personal but I remember the time when you didn't feel comfortable sharing your own food consumption preferences (something I find very respectable and reasonable). Can I ask what made you change your mind on the matter? Thanks. Keep up the great work, you are needed.
A: i've generally found it boring and a little unsettling to talk about physical body processes to a wide audience, HOWEVER, going into the AI era this is changing a little because i think being a real-blooded human-ass being is starting to become a more cherished thing to be proud of. like, i actually use toilets, if you can believe that shit

1.14.26

A: i dont plan exactly by year, but i have some ridiculous plans for both the near and distant future 1.14.26 12:39 am what should i do with my life i wouldnt want to spoil the surprise of the different possibilities you'll discover. actually they'd even surprise me because i dont know them

item.title: What's the difference between a connoisseur and an aficionado?
item.description:
1.14.26
Q: What's the difference between a connoisseur and an aficionado?
A: "connaisseur" is from french, meaning expert/judge/taster. "aficionado" is from spanish, it means a fan/enthusiast of something but it also means 'amateur'. The meanings of those 2 words may have merged together a little when used in english, but looking into french and spanish i can see that perhaps the connaisseur may perhaps be a little more high brow than the aficionado

item.title: any tips on how to reconcile with something you have to live with forever?
item.description:
1.14.26
Q: any tips on how to reconcile with something you have to live with forever?
A: it might be possible to use it to your advantage. ultimately that is the best way to handle these things, if at all possible

item.title: what does your average bass fx chain look like? any tips or warnings for people envious of your mixing?
item.description:
1.14.26
Q: what does your average bass fx chain look like? any tips or warnings for people envious of your mixing?
A: it probably will help a lot to clear the bass frequencies away from the non-bass instruments during times when the full band is playing. single out the instruments that are really doing the low frequency job (bass, kick) and let them have the low end, and keep that mostly out of the other instruments. this can help a lot. and also compressing the bass (not have a lot of loud-soft range) will help usually help. for some reason, wide loud-soft range is usually not too useful on the bass

item.title: I've always felt banjo is a bit of a subpar instrument. I mean, it produces a unique kind of sound so this fact alone justifies its existence, but to me it always lacked some richness and sexiness that comes from other stringed instruments like guitar. (Side note I just realized - banjo is kinda like a reverse bass. Or maybe ukulele is)
item.description:
1.14.26
Q: I've always felt banjo is a bit of a subpar instrument. I mean, it produces a unique kind of sound so this fact alone justifies its existence, but to me it always lacked some richness and sexiness that comes from other stringed instruments like guitar. (Side note I just realized - banjo is kinda like a reverse bass. Or maybe ukulele is)
A: I know it has its use cases and wouldn't want to tell anyone what to play bc who the heck am What are you thoughts on banjo? i've used it in probably the majority of my songs. it's incredibly groovy. so in this case i apologize, if you have ever listened to my music, for all the banjo in it 1.14.26 6:57 am What is your favourite jazz chord hot take there is no such thing as a 'jazz chord' and also a different chord is favored at each moment of the music 1.14.26 6:29 am have you ever thought of making a full length album? yes but i'd rather just make many many many songs

item.title: have you heard of the new instinct-vs-intellect explanation of the human condition and do you think it's probable? basically that our ape ancestors were completely instinctively orientated to love, but that when they developed a conscious mind it clashed with the instincts, causing it to become psychologically upset which is the mad state we still suffer from today and have for eons tried to free ourselves from
item.description:
1.14.26
Q: have you heard of the new instinct-vs-intellect explanation of the human condition and do you think it's probable? basically that our ape ancestors were completely instinctively orientated to love, but that when they developed a conscious mind it clashed with the instincts, causing it to become psychologically upset which is the mad state we still suffer from today and have for eons tried to free ourselves from
A: i think that's a bit of storytelling and it's certainly not the only way to look at it. another way to look at it (and also not the only way), for example, is: in the past, most animals have had to brutally fight each other for survival in many ways. Nowadays, we humans still find ourselves having to do that to some degree but we are deeply devoted to keeping this at an absolute minimum, we almost unilaterally consider it 'bad', and we are becoming increasingly more ashamed about it

item.title: Ive been playing guitar for a while and ive also recently started playing bass. Im still not too good at guitar even after having played it for a year already, and im new to bass so that's obvious how I'm doing. Have you got ANY good tips for continuing my learning of music in general, or anything specific about those instruments?
item.description:
1.15.26
Q: Ive been playing guitar for a while and ive also recently started playing bass. Im still not too good at guitar even after having played it for a year already, and im new to bass so that's obvious how I'm doing. Have you got ANY good tips for continuing my learning of music in general, or anything specific about those instruments?
A: you're going to figure out it all anyway, and it's going to be way more fun than if i tell you the wrong thing at the wrong time

item.title: Hello, I just wanted to thank you for something. See, someone I knew recently died of something that almost killed me, and I've been having a horrendous time dealing with all of the things my brain is doing about it. I was feeling exceptionally not OK, went on YT to watch some cat videos to try to calm down, and saw one of your videos in my recommendations. I decided out of curiosity to see which of your videos were released around the time I was sick. And I found out that you posted "if the world doesn't end" right when I was... not quite well yet, but through the dark and experiencing the miracle that I had survived. It helped end a panic attack (so did the cats.) It's so strangely comforting. So I just wanted to thank you. Please keep being weird and amazing. I suppose I need a question here, so... what do you want to do if the world doesn't end?
item.description:
1.15.26
Q: Hello, I just wanted to thank you for something. See, someone I knew recently died of something that almost killed me, and I've been having a horrendous time dealing with all of the things my brain is doing about it. I was feeling exceptionally not OK, went on YT to watch some cat videos to try to calm down, and saw one of your videos in my recommendations. I decided out of curiosity to see which of your videos were released around the time I was sick. And I found out that you posted "if the world doesn't end" right when I was... not quite well yet, but through the dark and experiencing the miracle that I had survived. It helped end a panic attack (so did the cats.) It's so strangely comforting. So I just wanted to thank you. Please keep being weird and amazing. I suppose I need a question here, so... what do you want to do if the world doesn't end?
A: make a huge pile of songs that is twice as high and twice as important as all the others before

item.title: the person who said banjo is subpar... what? they've certainly not heard it in the genre, and it can sound quite sad and wistful and profound in the right song. now my question for you: is there an instrument you feel you've underutilised or not used at all but would want to include more?

1.15.26
